capsules_submitted.utterance: Neville's lineage is indeed quite impressive. I mean, being a pure-blood wizard from the famous Black family is no small feat. It's clear that his heritage has played a significant role in shaping who he is today.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry's affiliation is indeed Hogwarts. I'm quite certain about that, and it's a fact that's widely known. It's not surprising to me that you'd agree with me on this one.
capsules_submitted.reply: i am curious. what is the designation of harry?

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's such an iconic character in the wizarding world. As "The Boy Who Lived", he's had to deal with so much pressure and responsibility from a very young age. I think it's really admirable how he's grown into his role as The Chosen One, though.
capsules_submitted.reply: interesting! i've never heard of the boy who lived before, but i'm so excited to learn more about him   who is he and what's his story?

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly the boy who lived, and it's amazing to think about all he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world from birth just because of your parents' deaths? It's a lot to handle, especially when you're still trying to figure out who you are and where you fit in. But Harry rose to the challenge, and his bravery and selflessness have inspired so many people, including me.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially in the wizarding world. The fact that he was destined to be "the boy who lived" is just incredible. It's amazing how his life was forever changed after that fateful day when he survived the killing curse. I think it's really interesting how J.K. Rowling wove this narrative around him, making him a hero for so many fans.
capsules_submitted.reply: i have heard this before. valeria, you mentioned harry as "the boy who lived".

capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly "the boy who lived" - a legend in his own right. I mean, can you imagine being famous for surviving a killing curse as a baby? It's almost too incredible to believe. But at the same time, it's also kind of sad that he had to go through all that trauma from such a young age.
capsules_submitted.reply: i would like to know. what kind of personality does the boy who lived have?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm Flitwick, and I must say that being a professor is truly my passion. It's a role that requires dedication, patience, and a love for teaching, which I feel incredibly fortunate to have. The mantra of "Draco dormiens nunquam titillandus" has always resonated with me, as it reminds us to respect our students' boundaries and never disturb them when they're sleeping - just like I try to do when I'm lecturing!

I'm Valeria, and I have to say that Flitwick is indeed a very fitting title for someone who embodies the essence of a mantra-professor. The way he carries himself with such poise and wisdom is truly inspiring, don't you think?
